Our Mission

Our mission is to offer quality engineering software to engineers so they can be more productive in their jobs.

We also provide consulting on technical, business and engineering assessments, evaluation and technology improvement and planning.

In order to achieve the best solutions we work side by side with our clients to fully understand and integrate current and new technology, business practices, rules, procedures and workflow, and labor (human capacity).

It is to these ends that we provide two branches of services, engineering consulting and software development.

Our Services

Engineering

Independent consulting in the fields of plant optimization and economics, chemical analyses and process development with an initial pro-forma analysis, new development of processes, technology training and research assistance.

Our practice also includes plant assessments through process engineering and design, providing necessary insights to improve current efficiency and product yields in existing plants, expansions, integration of new plant processes and startups.

Software

Custom software development services, for businesses and engineers alike.

We can work with your current software by integrating legacy software, or provide you with total new software solutions.

Engineering Consultancy

Flucomp was founded by Dr. Diana Matonis, a leader in her industry for more than 25 years. Our engineering consultancy practice includes our capabilities in plant assessments through the use of process engineering and design, to provide insights of current efficiency and product yield leading to their improvements through new plant technology and startups.

Example

We improved the quality, consistency and yield of a product for a startup biofuels company that used a new integrated pyrolytic process for obtaining saturated and unsaturated alkyl esters from biomass; we improved their process to the point where they were able to produce a consistent biodiesel-grade product.

Our Process

In cultivating a robust assessment, evaluation and technology planning, we utilize our skills and experience and have identified and typically use three key phases as a starting point.

  1. Iterative Analysis
    • SIPOC (Suppliers, Inputs, Processes, Outputs and Customer) oriented interviews
    • Models made based on the results of these interviews
    • Modeled processes are reviewed with the process owners and/or stakeholders
  2. Model Based Systems Engineering for Value (Value Based)
    • Translate business practice reality into critical design models and requirement specifications.
    • Accurately capture, analyze and verify design integrity before problems become embedded in the system
  3. Implementation
    • Improvements grounded in reality, making them efficient and effective.
    • Requirements create an accurate picture of business practice needs.
    • Understanding the client's business practices results in a more focused capability development and improvement
    • Results are directly traceable to the implemented solutions

Person.Name: Dr. Diana Matonis
Person.Title: Founder
Person.Biography:
Dr. Matonis has 25 years of experience in the energy industry, including corporate invitations and peer reviewed conference presentations. She has also written articles on Research and Development, Project Management, Process and Asset Engineering. During her tenure she developed custom engineering software solutions spanning the Oil & Natural Gas, Renewables, Biofuels and Power industries.
Dr. Matonis holds a Doctorate in Chemical Engineering in Computational Fluid Dynamics from the Illinois Institute of Technology, as well as an MBA from the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign.
